intro: Vincetoxicum flexuosum var. perrottetianum, commonly known as the perrottetianum agrimony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, arching stems that often trail along the ground, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, with a rough texture and prominent veins. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks.
